Course_Name: Space Geodesy and Navigation Seminar - SS24

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, We fixed the presentation dates of this semester's SGN Seminar. Please find the dates in the pdf file of this week (15.5. - 21.5.). We are looking forward to your presentations.  Robert Heinkelmann

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, dear advisors, dear professors, please mind an update to the presentations and dates of this semester's SGN Seminar. You can access the updated list entitled "2024_SGN Seminar - Dates_3.pdf" in week 12.6. - 18.6. in ISIS.  Thank you and best regards, Robert

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, dear advisors, dear professors, please mind an update to the presentations and dates of this semester's SGN Seminar. You can access the updated list entitled "2024_SGN Seminar - Dates_4.pdf" in week 19.6. - 25.6. in ISIS.  Thank you and best regards, Robert

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, dear advisors, dear professors, please mind an update to the presentations and dates of this semester's SGN Seminar. You can access the updated list entitled "2024_SGN Seminar - Dates_5.pdf" in week 26.6. - 2.7. in ISIS.  Thank you and best regards, Robert

Discussions.Discussion_Name: SGN Seminar - announcement of two extraordinary talks

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, Please mind the announcement of  two extraordinary Seminar talks: - Basics of Scientific Presentation (lecturer: Dr. R. Heinkelmann) on June 5th and - How to Write a Scientific Paper (lecturer: Dr. W. Neumann) on June 12th. Participation is mandatory for Seminar students and optional for those who listened to these talks already (e.g. Project students).  Thank you for attention. Robert and Wladimir

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, thank you for your interest in cooperating with a Professor and Advisor in the frame of the SGN Seminar / Project Summer Term 2024. 1) Please note the procedure and rules of this module: lecture "SGN Seminar - introduction". 2) Please compile your ranked short list of SGN Seminar topics (3 topics) from the list of available topics "SGN Seminar - Topics" and e-mail your short list to heinkelmann@campus.tu-berlin.de OR agree with a Prof. / Advisor about an own topic and inform me about it (heinkelmann@campus.tu-berlin.de). On behalf of the Professors, Advisors and the organizer, we wish you a successful start into the semester! Regards,  Robert Heinkelmann

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, your ranked short list of three topics is due today.  Regards, Robert

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear students, sorry for the delay of one week. I was waiting for a few students to receive replies. Now, I published the list of topics assigned this semester (see pdf file of this week). It is preliminary and still requires some confirmation. Please read the list and check whether you are fine with your assigned topic.  Students are now suggested to contact the advisor and to start working on their topics.  Next, after confirmation of the topics, I will compile a list of the presentation dates.  So long, Robert

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Dear Profs., dear advisors, dear students, we have the almost ready list of topics for this semester (see file uploaded this week). Only small changes might take place. Hence, I invite the students to pursue their work and reach out to their advisors. Please let me know, if you need contact details of your advisor.  Best regards, Robert

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Getting started with the SGN Seminar

Messages.Author: Robert Heinkelmann
Messages.Content: Hello and welcome, dear Students. The ST2024 SGN Seminar will start on April 24th with a general introduction and a presentation of potential Seminar topics. Before that date there will be no Seminar lessons. If you intend to do the Seminar, you must attend this session. For now, in order to estimate how many students will start within this Seminar, please send an email to me (heinkelmann@campus.tu-berlin.de) that you intend to do the Seminar. Indicate also whether you have a Seminar topic (and an advisor) already (what is the topic?)  or you need a new topic. Please do so until the end of this week April 19th.  Thank you so much and have a successful start,  Robert
